sections.heading: Team Composition
rules: Each team will consist of 8 players.
Before the match, a lottery will be conducted to decide the 8th player of the team from the available girls aged 11+ up to 14 years.
If a team is short of one player, the opposition captain will decide which player will repeat batting and bowling for the short-handed team.

sections.heading: Match Format
rules: Each match will be an 8-over match.
The batting team must divide the entire team into 4 pairs.
Each batting pair can bat for a maximum of 2 overs.

sections.heading: Batting & Scoring Rules
rules: 4s and 6s are allowed.
Allowed modes of dismissal: Bowled, Caught, Run Out & Stumped out
If the bowling team takes a wicket, -4 runs will be deducted from the batting team's total.

sections.heading: Bowling Rules
rules: Only one bowler is allowed to bowl a maximum of 2 overs.
All other bowlers can bowl a maximum of 1 over each.
Overstepping will be treated as a No Ball.
Waist-height full toss will also be treated as a No Ball.

sections.heading: Batting Guard & Stance
rules: Batters are not allowed to cover the wicket.
First-wicket guard is not permitted.
Batters may take only middle-wicket or third-wicket guard.
The umpire may request a batter to adjust stance if required.

sections.heading: Chasing & Overs Completion
rules: Even if the second batting team crosses the target before the 6th over, they must bat for all 8 overs.
Net Run Rate (NRR) will be calculated at the end in case of league-stage ties.

sections.heading: Tie-Breaker
rules: In case of a tie, a Super Over will be conducted to decide the winner.

sections.heading: League-to-Final Special Rule
rules: After the league stage, the best 4 cricket players (batters or bowlers) from the third-placed team will be inducted into the finalist teams through a lottery system.

sections.heading: Spirit of the Game & Authority
rules: Players are expected to maintain fair play and sportsmanship.
